intro: Primula bella subsp. moschophora, commonly known as the fragrant primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and oval, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom in early spring. It prefers well-drained, loamy soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a valued ornamental plant in horticulture.
